name: Rain
description: Set at foot of Angel's Flight Fountain in L.A. across from The Water Grill. The rain represents my tears as my first husband Art and I divorced. Figures are Art and The Artist. Culturally elite Bunker Hill is juxtaposed against downtown's skid row. This is one of my earliest paintings, and to name drop, was a favorite of Nobel Laureate Maurice Wilkins. There is a print available, one of the first archival digital inkjet prints from noted L.A. artist, the late Richard Duardo.
